subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] Re: Reading practice - The Raven
msgSnippet: ... Anthony, Here are some words that make my Boston accent different from others: * We pronounce car and park by totally dropping the r but elongnating
messageBody:
Anthony Grahn wrote:
>
>
> Very cool choice Paul, very cool.
>
> I wonder though if I could ask a favor for future Virginian QS
> writers and people of like accents: Could I bother you for sample words
> you use for each of the QS letters? And also could you list which QS
> letters you would never use?
>
> Your accent differs from mine and surely represents many millions of
> people and I'm trying to put together a grand list of accents to
> post up to this site.
>

Anthony,

Here are some words that make my Boston accent different from others:

* We pronounce "car" and "park" by totally dropping the "r" but
elongnating the preceeding vowel. (This distinction is probably not
relevant to QS.)

* We pronounce Otto and auto the same way. Likewise, we pronounce tot
and taught the same way, with the Awl sound.

* We pronounce pair, peer, pier, and pear the same exact way. Likewise
we pronounce beer and bear the same way, with an Eat as the vowel.

That's all I can think of for now.

I'm really glad you are doing this.

Paul
